body:
### Description

I have setup an auto command to format files on save
`autocmd BufWritePre *.js,*.json lua vim.lsp.buf.format({async = true}`
 and I am using the `vscode-json-language-server` via `jsonls`.

Every time I save, the JSON gets formatted as expected, but it also 'reformats' a formatted file so it looks like the buffer has been edited. 

This issue get resolved when it set `async = false`, but it would be nice if i didn't have to.
Note: I tried using versions of nvim-lspconfig as old as of Jan 2022. The issue was still there.

PS: I know this is a very small issue, but thought it would be nice if it is recorded.

Run :checkhealth for more info

### Nvim-lspconfig version

295c646488d5baa63c6c4da68fe61171b9257375

### Operating system and version

Ubuntu 23.04

### Affected language servers

jsonls

### Steps to reproduce

Save a formatted json file.

### Actual behavior

Formats the file even if it is already formatted, and writes to the buffer.
So the `+` icon on buffer is always there.

### Expected behavior

Formats the file if not formatted.
So maximum of two saves required (One extra because of async) 

### Minimal config

```Lua
local nvim_lsp = require'lspconfig'
nvim_lsp.jsonls.setup {}

autocmd BufWritePre *.js,*.json lua vim.lsp.buf.format({async = true}
```


### LSP log

-

comment_data.body: because it's async  . when you save file autocmd execute, the format function it's async it send lsp request and not wait response the  callback insert to the event loop callback queue . then vim do save file . then event loop check queue find it run it .format your buffer . modified changed so you see `+` . it work as expect. not bug.

title: jsonls formats and writes to buffer even if it is already formatted.
